STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 18, 2021
Alison Morrison
Shiawassee County DHHS
1720 E Main St
Owosso, MI 48867
RE: License #: CP780201406
Shiawassee County DHHS
1720 E Main St
Owosso, MI 48867
Dear Ms. Morrison:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 10/15/2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Settlement Agreement (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective action plan is required.
It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 660-8309
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12502 Program statement.
(2) An agency shall give a copy of the program statement to a
youth before placement in independent living.
One of three independent living case records did not have documentation the
program statement was provided to the youth.
R 400.12503 Policy and procedures.
(3) An agency shall provide a youth in independent living with a
copy of the agency's policies and procedures required by this
rule.
One of three independent living case records did not have documentation the
policies and procedures were provided to the youth.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
10/26/20 renewal, CAP approved 10/29/20
R 400.12505 Supervision.
(2) An agency shall provide the following minimum supervision:
(b) At monthly intervals, ensure that the youth is complying
with the terms of the contract required by R 400.125010,
continues to reside in a safe and acceptable environment, and
is managing expenditures.
One of three independent living case records did not have documentation that
finances were reviewed with the youth on a monthly basis.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please
note that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not
be included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
4

FOM 722-08E Action Summary
Page 3 and 6
Placement Change: Prior to a planned placement change, or
within three business days of an emergency placement change,
the caseworker must document…
Foster Care/ Juvenile Justice Program/Case Closure Within
three business days of foster care and/or juvenile justice
program/case closure, the caseworker must document…
Three of nine foster care and independent living files did not have action summaries
completed within the required timeframes.
FOM 722-06H Case Contacts
Page 19
All case contacts must be entered in MiSACWIS, including
attempted contacts and missed appointments. The case contact
narrative should consist of a brief summary of the contact.
Significant information obtained during the contact must be
summarized in the appropriate section of the case service plan.
The caseworker must enter the required face-to-face contacts
listed below in MISACWIS within five business days of the
contact. This includes attempted and missed face-to-face
contacts.
Six of nine foster care and independent living files did not have face to face contacts
entered into MISACWIS within the required timeframe.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Signatures- The MDHHS Policy office recently clarified that PATPs and Medical
Passports need to be signed by any non-respondent parent that has placement
of their child. This non-respondent parent must sign as the ‘placement provider’.
As this was previously unclear in policy, the missing signatures were not cited.
However, the agency was advised this expectation will be required going
forward.
 Signatures- The agency was reminded to note on the signature line of any
document where a parent signature is required, if the parent refuses to sign or
cannot be located.
 MISACWIS- The agency was advised to consult policy for timeframes required
for documents to be uploaded into MiSACWIS. Although there have been
challenges with uploading documents due to staff working remotely during the
5

pandemic, it is expected that documents will be uploaded within the required
timeframes.
 IL/YAVFC- Clarification was provided to the agency that all IL Licensing Rules
must be followed for all youth residing in a IL placement type, including those
youth with YAVFC legal status.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VII. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The CAP (approved 10/29/2020) was a result of the 10/26/20 renewal evaluation.
During this review the agency only had one repeat violation, which was due to a
misunderstanding regarding the need to follow IL rules for YAVFC cases. Overall,
the agency showed compliance with their CAP and improvement in several areas.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment indicated the past year was challenging with
staff working remotely due to the pandemic. Staff had difficulty with printing and
signing documents as they could not print at home and were not able to go into the
office. In addition, there were several policy changes during this review period, which
staff had to adjust to. Overall, staff reportedly handled these challenges well and
adapted as needed. The CA reported that monthly CAP meetings were held virtually
to ensure CAP compliance through their quality assurance practices. The group
would bring the management team and case workers together to review progress
made, hear challenges or ideas, and make changes to the CAP if needed. The CA
indicated this has been successful in showing the whole team how their actions
affect compliance.
Interviews
Two staff were interviewed, one foster care and one licensing. Both staff reported
the past year was challenging due to the pandemic, but supervisors and
administration have been very helpful. Both staff reported feeling supported and
encouraged in their job. Neither staff had suggestions for improvements that could
be made at the agency.
6

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules, MISEP requirements, or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
_ ________________October 18, 2021__
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
October 18, 2021
_______________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
